page.title: 05THE SAWMILL-A LOCAL INDUSTRY
page.content: Walford Caravans and a caravan park are a tribute to the tourist industry; Bigwood agricultural suppliers shows the large farming concern;other firms reflect the area's potential. Taunton Sawmills is an example of a local industry.10 people,9 men and one lady,work there.The sawmill is 8 years old and its machinery is run entirely by electricity.Douglas fir,spruce and pine are used.All the prepared timber is used to make fencing.No timber is wasted because the sawdust goes to a farmer for his cattle's bedding, other waste to a factory at South Moulton to be made into chipboard. Lorries bring 16 tonnes of wood a day.The men work five days a week.The saws used to cut the timber are sharpened every day.One union rule is to wear earphones in order to prevent deafness,caused by the high volume of noise in the mill.
